intro: Ceratocephalus arnicodes, commonly known as the spiny cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes the carrot and parsley family, despite its cactus-like appearance. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and small, clustered white flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. The leaves are typically reduced to small scales, and the plant is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
